definition: house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: We enlarged the house by adding a west wing.
sentences.chinese: 我们加盖西厢房以扩建房屋。

sentences.english: There are also east and west wings and the stage for entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 围内也设东西厢房，还有戏台等娱乐场所。

sentences.english: West wing master suite guest bedroom. I'm not picky.
sentences.chinese: 西厢房，主卧，客房，我不挑的。

sentences.english: Prince smell speech rapidly into the wings ready to see in the queen.
sentences.chinese: 太子闻言急速步入厢房换衣准备入宫面见皇后。

sentences.english: The autumn morning is chilly. She puts on a sweater and leaves the wing room.
sentences.chinese: 秋天的早晨有些冷，查宜弟穿上一件毛衣，出了厢房。

sentences.english: And between the chambers was the breadth of twenty cubits round about the house on every side.
sentences.chinese: 厢房之外有二十肘宽的空地，环绕著殿的四周。

sentences.english: One is the maid, who sleeps on the other side of the house.
sentences.chinese: 一位是女仆，她睡在对面厢房里。

sentences.english: Our family covers the west wing rooms. There's a smaller lawn behind them.
sentences.chinese: 我们住在西进厢房，后面还有一个比较小的草皮。

sentences.english: Lidazhao lived in the main room, north on the east wing after his marriage.
sentences.chinese: 李大钊结婚后就住在东厢房北面的正房。

sentences.english: I live in the west wing of the house.
sentences.chinese: 我住在这栋房子的西厢房。

sentences.english: School is a temple, classrooms God is broken off plastic wing spirits.
sentences.chinese: 学校是一座古庙，教室是打碎神塑赶走神灵的厢房。

definition: central building (in a traditional house)/primary wife
a room in a Buddhist monastery/a temple
reception pavilion (generally part of a large residence, and often built in a garden)
warm room/warm partition of a room
central room of a traditional Chinese house
main hall of a Buddhist temple
